Description: Unfinished crescentic axe-head: with deep full blade and well-rounded sides. It has inward curving, sharply pointed lateral tangs and an extended central tang which appears to have been bevelled with a file at the butt. Roughly hammered flanges are present around both scallops, but the cutting end was not worked to an edge. The blade is lightly corroded and traces of the original haft survive on the central tang.
Bibliographic references: Davies 1987 / Catalogue of Egyptian Antiquities in the British Museum (90)
